  • Field Details

    • finishedconstruction

      protected boolean finishedconstruction
      Indicates whether the construction phase has been completed. This variable is utilized to track the state of the construction process within the initialization phase.

  • Constructor Details

    • Initialization_Phase_State

      public Initialization_Phase_State(Game game)
      Constructs a new Initialization_Phase_State object, initializing the game state for the initialization phase. Initializes the available ship colors and sets the construction status to not finished.
      Parameters:
      game - The game instance associated with the initialization phase state.

  • Method Details

    • JoinGame

      public void JoinGame(String nickname, int NumOfPlayers) throws Exception
      Allows a player to join the game by providing a nickname and specifying the number of players. This method initializes the player's ship, assigns a color, and places specific game tiles based on the color. Additionally, it sets up the player's flight board and transitions the game to the next phase once all players have joined.
      Overrides:
      JoinGame in class GameState
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player joining the game
      NumOfPlayers - the total number of players in the game
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an issue during the game setup or if necessary resources (e.g., tiles) are not found

    • buildFlightBoard

      public void buildFlightBoard() throws RuntimeException
      Builds the flight board during the initialization phase of the game. This method is a placeholder and currently not implemented.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if called, as the operation is not supported.

    • fillBank

      public void fillBank()
      Initializes and fills the game's bank with predefined quantities of resources. Creates a new Bank instance containing 100 units each of yellow goods, red goods, green goods, blue goods, and battery, and sets this instance as the game's bank using the setGameBank method.

    • buildTiles

      public void buildTiles() throws RuntimeException
      Builds the set of tiles during the initialization phase of the game. This method is responsible for generating or arranging the tiles needed for the gameplay as part of the initialization sequence. Throws a RuntimeException indicating that the method is not currently supported. This is likely a placeholder, and the implementation of this behavior is expected in future development.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the method is invoked without implementation.

    • goNextState

      public void goNextState()
      Advances the game to the next state based on the number of players. Removes specific game tiles from the game board as part of the state transition. Depending on the number of players in the game: - For 2 players, it removes the tiles with IDs 61 and 34 from the game board. - For 3 players, it removes the tile with ID 34 from the game board. If the specified tiles are not found, a RuntimeException is thrown. This method relies on the structure of the game and its tiles and assumes that the game state and tile configuration are valid before invocation.
